sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含"唱"之意。
means: sing ： 普通用词，泛指一般的歌唱或发出悦耳的声音。
hum ： 指闭着双唇而不唱出字来，低语般的哼唱。

sentence.Network_en: She didn't know anything about music but she liked to sing.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然她对音乐一无所知，但却爱唱歌。

sentence.Network_en: You can sing along to your favourite Elvis hits.
sentence.Network_cn: 你可以跟着一起唱你最喜爱的“猫王”的热门歌曲。

sentence.Network_en: Some people tried to sing, but their voices soon died raggedly away.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些人试图唱歌，但他们的声音很快就陆续消失了。

entry.def: When you sing, you make musical sounds with your voice, usually producing words that fit a tune.

example.ex: I sing about love most of the time...

entry.tran: (鸟类或昆虫)鸣叫，啼，啁啾，啼啭
entry.def: When birds or insects sing, they make pleasant high-pitched sounds.

example.ex: Birds were already singing in the garden.
example.tran: 小鸟已经在花园里歌唱了。

entry.tran: (尤指同一组织里的人)口径一致，意见一致
entry.def: If you say that people, especially people in the same organization, are singing from the same hymn sheet or are singing from the same song sheet, you mean that they are saying the same things in public about something and appear to agree about it.

example.ex: We should bring together the departments so that we're all singing from the same hymn sheet.
example.tran: 我们应该把各部门联合起来，这样我们就能意见一致了。

sentences.sentence: "She was singing while she was cooking"

Sentence.sentence: The reaction to his death, with people leaving candles and flowers outside Apple stores and politicians singing praises on the internet, is proof that Mr Jobs had become something much more significant than just a clever money-maker.

When they go on tour, they do a vast number of concerts, singing in smoky places.
When making music gets too easy, says White, it becomes harder to make it sing.

sentences.en: If you sing before breakfast, you'll cry before dinner.
My brother can't sing a note.
sentences.cn: 我的兄弟一点也不会唱。

sentences.en: Miss Rose will sing a song now.
sentences.cn: 现在露丝小姐将唱一支歌。

sentences.en: The mother sang her baby a lullaby.
sentences.cn: 妈妈给孩子唱了一支催眠曲。

sentences.en: Will you sing a song for[to] us?

means.word_mean: (鸟)鸣, 啭, 啼; 嗡嗡叫

sentences.en: As I walked on, some birds were singing in the woods.
sentences.cn: 我走着, 林中鸟在鸣叫。

sentences.en: The kettle was singing on the fire.
sentences.cn: 水壶在炉火上嗡嗡作响。

sentences.en: Birds sing loudest in the early morning.

jushi.english: The boys walked past us, singing merrily.
jushi.chinese: 孩子们欢快地唱着从我们身边走过。

jushi.english: You are not singing in tune.
The steam sang as it escaped from the pipe.
jushi.chinese: 蒸汽从管子喷出时呜呜作响。
